meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: YOU MAY WANT TO HOLD YOUR BREATH

A team of Korean scientists set up some traps to catch viruses and bacteria floating in the air. They set up their traps in Seoul, in an industrial complex in western Korea, and in a forest. Based on their collection, they came to some mind blowing conclusions.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Syb67L&via=Digg&text=The Infected Air

div.div: THE MORE YOU KNOW
Here's how school teacher Sarah Bourland explains the amazing capture in an email to HuffPost Travel.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UCwUBi&via=Digg&text=The Stingray Photobomb Explained

div.div: THOSE KIDS ARE GOING PLACES

div.a: Google Now World's Second-Largest Tech Company

div.div: Google has surpassed Microsoft to become the world’s second-largest technology company as computing over the Internet reduces demand for software installed on desktop machines.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/STgmZJ&via=Digg&text=Google Now World's Second-Largest Tech Company

div.div: COLLECT 'EM ALL!

div.a: Amazon Criticized For Selling Concentration Camp Puzzle

div.div: Amazon.com has come under pressure for selling a children's puzzle bearing the image of the crematorium at the infamous Nazi concentration camp Dachau.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QRxlqv&via=Digg&text=Amazon Criticized For Selling Concentration Camp Puzzle

div.div: INVEST IN YOUR FUTURE

div.a: Planetary Resources Now Hiring 'Asteroid Miner' Interns

div.div: Planetary Resources, the would-be asteroid mining company backed by notable billionaires including James Cameron and Google's co-founders, has posted its first official internship opening for "asteroid miners."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Pn9sWv&via=Digg&text=Planetary Resources Now Hiring 'Asteroid Miner' Interns

div.div: POLITICS

div.a: Ahmadinejad's Cameraman Defected During His U.N. Visit

div.div: A Iranian cameraman who came to New York as part of Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's visit to the United Nations last week is reportedly seeking asylum in the United States.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Su1TxW&via=Digg&text=Ahmadinejad's Cameraman Defected During His U.N. Visit

div.div: Q LIED TO US

div.a: James Bond Tech Still Beyond Our Reach

div.div: Despite the decades between the imagined Bond universe and the real world today, Bond and the supervillains he confronted still have the edge in terms of technology now available today.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Qvw1Je&via=Digg&text=James Bond Tech Still Beyond Our Reach

div.div: WHAT DOES '3D' STAND FOR?

div.a: Everything You Ever Wanted To Know About 3D Printing

div.div: With 3D printers finally accessible to hobbyists, schools and small businesses, what does that mean for the future of making stuff?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QS3Rsr&via=Digg&text=Everything You Ever Wanted To Know About 3D Printing

div.div: WAY HARSH

div.a: New Anti-Downloading Law Goes Into Effect In Japan

div.div: Japan has just put into effect the world's most draconian anti-piracy law. In most countries, users are only targeted when they upload copyright-infringing material, but in Japan simply downloading unauthorized material could result in a jail sentence.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PFs1qd&via=Digg&text=New Anti-Downloading Law Goes Into Effect In Japan

div.div: ECONOMIC BANDITS

Four years have passed since Lehman Brothers’ collapse; two since Obama signed financial reform into law; one since the occupation of Zuccotti Park. But the Justice Department has yet to convict a single high-profile banker.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RtZV3y&via=Digg&text=Why Wall Street Got Off

div.div: NOT JUST A PAPERWEIGHT

div.a: The Kindle Paperwhite Is A Reader’s Dream

div.div: The e-reader arms race moves at a glacial pace. Barnes & Noble does one thing, Amazon follows. Amazon adds a feature and, slowly but surely, B&N adds the same thing. The Kindle Paperwhite is the latest shot in the war.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SwqJg8&via=Digg&text=The Kindle Paperwhite Is A Reader’s Dream

div.div: HIS AND HIS DESIGN

div.a: Women Erased From Saudi Arabia IKEA Catalogue

div.div: Ikea's catalogue is printed in 198 million copies and looks almost the same in 27 languages ​​and in 38 countries. With one big exception.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QRxDO6&via=Digg&text=Women Erased From Saudi Arabia IKEA Catalogue

div.div: BOOMSHAKALAKA IS COMING

div.a: Game Of Thrones House Sigils For Videogame Families

div.div: Here's something nobody asked for, but we're happy somebody made.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Ogl8zv&via=Digg&text=Game Of Thrones House Sigils For Videogame Families

div.div: SYNERGY
We’re happy to report that Digg for iPad and an update to Digg for iPhone 5 are now live in the app store!

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OpJlgB&via=Digg&text=Digg For iPad + Reading Sync

div.div: INVEST IN GLOW-IN-THE-DARK STAR STICKERS

Are cyber attacks really a clear and present danger to society's critical life support systems, capable of inflicting thousands of casualties? Or has fear of full-blown cybergeddon at the hands of America's enemies become just another feverish national obsession -- another of the long, dark shadows of the 9/11 attacks?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Sv0R4V&via=Digg&text=If The Lights Went Out

div.div: FINISH HIM
You know what would make politics more interesting? If it were reimagined as a series of video game fights.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U0i78O&via=Digg&text=Political Kombat

div.div: MARGIN FOR MADNESS

div.a: 'The. Polls. Have. Stopped. Making. Any. Sense.'

div.div: American politics has gone gaga for poll numbers—while polling pros feel less and less certain about the methodology behind the madness.

li.div: The voodoo science of political polling by @zengerle nymag.com/news/features/electi...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Sgbhe3&via=Digg&text='The. Polls. Have. Stopped. Making. Any. Sense.'

div.div: ZUCK'S LOVIN' IT

div.a: Zuckerberg Lands In Moscow, Eats At McDonald's

div.div: Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg was Monday in Moscow on a visit the government believes should stimulate innovation in Russia and the social network hopes will boost its position in the Russian market.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U1M8oN&via=Digg&text=Zuckerberg Lands In Moscow, Eats At McDonald's

div.div: TROLL LIKE MIKE
Mark your calendars, everyone, because it's October 1, 2012, and Michael Jordan is officially on to us.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QSSWyR&via=Digg&text=Michael Jordan Is Trolling America

div.div: RICH PEOPLE PROBLEMS
The growing antagonism of the super-wealthy toward Obama can seem mystifying, since Obama has served the rich quite well.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ST8JSY&via=Digg&text=Why Do Billionaires Feel Victimized?
